snippet: A federal appeals court held that the agency must disclose, at least to a judge, a description of its records on drone strikes in response to a lawsuit by the American Civil Liberties Union.
abstract: Federal appeals court holds that Central Intelligence Agency must disclose, at least to a judge, description of its records on drone strikes to kill terrorism suspects abroad in response to lawsuit by American Civil Liberties Union.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court held that the agency must disclose, at least to a judge, a description of its records on drone strikes in response to a lawsuit by the American Civil Liberties Union.

headline.seo: Court Says C.I.A. Must Yield Some Data on Drones
headline.main: Court Orders the C.I.A. to Disclose Drone Data
headline.print_headline: Court Orders The C.I.A. To Disclose Drone Data
